chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Wagner

records.addlTxt:
8:37AM Defendant Daniel J. Wagner appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Daniel J. Wagner. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses Mr. Seifert who states if Mr. Wagner pleads guilty on Count 1 Possession of Meth-PTAC-Repeater and Count 4 Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child <6yrs)-Repeater, state intends to dismiss Count 2 Possession of THC(2nd+)-Repeater and Count 3 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater- PTAC.  Mr. Wagner is incarcerated at Dodge Correctional Institute on 5 yrs incarceration from violated extended supervision based on these incidents in Pepin Co. If he pleads, joint recommendation court costs be ordered and 200 days jail and has 200 days jail credit.  Atty Rivard agrees with Mr. Seifert and Mr. Wagner verifies he received PLQ although they have not been returned to Atty Rivard.  Mr. Wagner informs he mailed them back.  Court advises Mr. Wagner of count 1/max. penalties; count 4/max. penalties; and advised of right to appear personally.  Mr. Wagner agrees to conduct the hearing in this fashion. 
Court read Mr. Wagner his rights, felony prohibitions charges means no firearms and cannot vote.  Mr. Wagner pleads NC to Count 1 & 4.  Court accepts Mr. Wagner's pleas, find him guilty on Counts 1 & 4, DRI counts 2 & 3.  Atty Rivard asks the court accept the agreement and stipulates factual basis for pleas.  Court finds the agreement reasonable, and will impose 200 days jail with credit for 200 days served concurrent to the Dunn Co. matter he is serving and to any Chippewa County matter he's also serving as well.  Court costs of $518.00 on each count would be $1036.00.  Pay $100/mo starting 90 days after release from Stanley and Mr. Wagner notify the COC of release date. Advised of appeal rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:35 PM Defendant Daniel J. Wagner appeared by zoom technology by video means from Stanley Correctional Institute. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared with defendant by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court ; advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties and constitutional rights.  NGP entered on all counts.  Based upon discussions with Mr. Seifert we probably have this resolved and just need to review agreement with Mr. Wagner.  Set possible plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:41 PM Defendant Daniel J. Wagner appeared by video means from the Pepin County Jail with counsel Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rivard recommends to waive PH.  Court advises Mr. Wagner of right to PH.  Defendant waives his PH.  Court finds on advise of counsel, Mr. Wagner waives right to PH.  State to file Information.  Defendant unsure if he will be in the Pepin Co. Jail in June or if will be in Dodge.  Arraignment scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:28 PM Defendant Daniel J. Wagner appeared by zoom technology by video means from the Pepin County Jail with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  State has discussed his matter with Attorney Rivard and he needs to discuss matter with his client.  Defendant will either be in the Pepin Co. Jail or Dodge on 5/3.  Mr. Wagner to notify the Clerk of Court if he moves so notice can be sent to Dodge.  Mr. Rivard continues to waive time limits for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 01:31 PM Defendant Daniel J. Wagner appeared by video means from the Pepin County Jail. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waiting for his PO hold to be released.  Court advised of right to an attorney and right to PH within 10 days of today.  Defendant wishes counsel.  Court finds Mr. Wagner knowingly & voluntarily waives time limits but not the PH itself.  Mr. Schroeder informs Mr. Wagner he can contact the PD office to apply for representation.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:44 AM Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel J. Wagner appeared by video means in custody without counsel. Court informs DA to review repeater allegation. Court informs Defendant of charges and maximum penalty w/o repeater enhancer. Court gives Defendant his rights. DA informs Court of Defendant's criminal history. DA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders $1000 signature bond with conditions of no possession or consumption of controlled substances or alcohol, No entrance into bars/taverns unless for employment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession or consumption of controlled substances or alcohol.
No entrance into bars or taverns except for employment.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Given to Defendant while still in custody.
